title: What is the English translation or summary of the Japanese spoken in the song Kaikoma by the band Skyharbor? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Japanese passage VERY roughly translated:  You only have one lifeDon't let your mistakes be the end all, be all It's important not to reject life Trust, Betrayal, Hope, Despair Because everything is Hyouriittai What and who will you hold dear to you? Think clearly on it.  Hyouriittai- Two sides of the same coin. This phrase means that even if you look at something like a piece of paper from both sides, even if there are different things written on each side it's still the same piece of paper. Source: YouTube comments
